p: According to Pieroni et al. [ 14], the potential of wild plants should be further explored for the possible economic opportunities that could be generated for local gatherers and communities. The diversification of production using such resources could be a socio-economically sustainable activity in areas with non-optimal farming conditions by contributing to population stabilization in rural areas [ 94]. Herbs are, therefore, also an opportunity to develop a healthy diet that combines gastronomy, health and sustainability.
